headline: California American Water President Addresses New ASCE Report Card, Urges More Investment in Critical Water Infrastructure
summary: SAN DIEGO, March 26, 2025--Kevin Tilden, President of California American Water, issued the following statement in response to the grades of C- for water and D+ for wastewater in the American Society of Civil Engineers' 2025 Report Card for America’s Infrastructure.

headline: Pennsylvania American Water President Addresses New ASCE Report Card, Urges More Investment in Critical Water Infrastructure
summary: MECHANICSBURG, Pa., March 26, 2025--Justin Ladner, President of Pennsylvania American Water, issued the following statement in response to the grades of C- for water and D+ for water and wastewater in the American Society of Civil Engineers' (ASCE) 2025 Report Card for America’s Infrastructure.

raw.headline: Pennsylvania American Water President Addresses New ASCE Report Card, Urges More Investment in Critical Water Infrastructure
raw.summary: MECHANICSBURG, Pa., March 26, 2025--Justin Ladner, President of Pennsylvania American Water, issued the following statement in response to the grades of C- for water and D+ for water and wastewater in the American Society of Civil Engineers' (ASCE) 2025 Report Card for America’s Infrastructure.

headline: American Water and the City of Camden Highlight Water Infrastructure Improvements to Continue Safe, Clean and Reliable Water Service in the Camden Community
summary: CAMDEN, N.J., March 26, 2025--American Water (NYSE: AWK), the largest regulated water and wastewater utility company in the U.S, in partnership with the City of Camden, highlights its continued commitment to improving the City's water infrastructure through partnership and investment.
